topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack 1.0: Add New Scale-out Proxy Node

body.p: This topic shows how to add a proxy node to the store account and container ring.

ul.li: HPE Helion OpenStack cloud is successfully deployed.(Starter Swift nodes are functional by default as they are part of cloud deployment)

section.title: Deploying new node(s)
section.p: Perform the steps mentioned in Provision Node(s) to deploy a new node.

section.title: Update load balancer with new Proxy nodes

li.p: Log in to the undercloud from seed.
Change the directory to ring builder.
Copy account, container, object, and generated object-1.ring.gz files to proxy nodes and press yes when asked to authenticate the node.
Copy account, container, object, and generated object-1.builder files to proxy nodes.
After creation of the Proxy node, list the Proxy IP addresses.
Edit swift-proxy.cfg on each of the controller nodes.
Add the following content in the swift-proxy.cfg file.

codeblock.codeph: listen scale_swift_proxy bind <Virtual IP (running on the controller nodes)>:8080 server <proxy node hostname> <proxy nodes IP address>:8080 check inter 2000 rise 2 fall 5

ul.li: The number of "server" lines equals the number of Swift Proxies you have set up.

codeblock.codeph: # ssh heat-admin@<Controller Node IP address> # sudo -i

li.p: Run the following command to view the virtual IP of the controller nodes
Restart the HA Proxy service on all these nodes.

section.p: The Swift Proxies are now successfully enabled with HA Proxy.
